"'''I've got a very Briny Notion'''" is the first line of a poem written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] around [[1945]] that is sung by [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham]] in ''[[The Notion Club Papers]]''.<ref name="poem">{{SD|65}}, p. 225</ref>

==History==
According to [[Night 65]]<ref name="poem"/> in ''[[The Notion Club Papers]]'' that were discovered by [[Howard Green]] in [[Seventh Age 2012|2012]],<ref name="Foreword">{{SD|2b}}</ref> all the main members of the [[Notion Club]]<ref name="Foreword"/> attended a meeting held in [[Philip Frankley]]'s rooms at [[Wikipedia:The Queen's College (Oxford)|Queen's]] on [[8 May]] [[Seventh Age 1987|1987]]. After around the first hour of this meeting, [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham]] arrived at around 9:30 pm, singing:<ref name="poem"/>

<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
:I've got a very Briny Notion
::To drink myself to sleep.<ref name="poem"/></poem>

Afterwards, Lowdham was quite restless, refusing to sit down. During the next thirty minutes or so, Lowdham would occasionally burst into attempts at continuing his song, seldom getting further than the aforementioned first two lines:<ref name="poem"/>

<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
:Bring me my bowl, my magic potion!
::Tonight Iâ€™m diving deep.
:::down! down! down!
::Down where the dream-[[fish]] go.<ref name="poem"/></poem>

The other members, notably [[Michael George Ramer]], did not take it well. As a result, Lowdham's singing intervals became less frequent. At around 10:00 pm, the conversation, led by Frankley and Lowdham, turned to neologisms.<ref name="poem"/>
